p.The Middle Eastern Studies minor is desi: The Middle Eastern Studies minor is designed to complement a student's major area of study. The minor requires a core of Middle Eastern Studies courses as well as a selection of directed electives.

courseSection0.text:
The Middle Eastern Studies minor is designed to complement a student's major area of study. The minor requires a core of Middle Eastern Studies courses as well as a selection of directed electives.
Minor Admission Requirements
None
Minor Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
None

courseSection0.text0: CPO3403 - Politics of the Middle East (3)

courseSection1.text0: Additional courses may be used only with prior permission of the program director.
courseSection1.text1: Although not required, students are strongly encouraged to complete at least one year of Arabic (ARA 1120C, ARA 1121C) and/or Hebrew (HBR 1120, HBR 1121).
courseSection1.text2: A list of approved restricted elective courses is found in the myKnight audit.
courseSection1.text3:
Earn at least 9 credits from the following: 
ARA2200 - Intermediate Arabic Language and Civilization I (3)
ASH3222 - Islam and Its Empires (3)
CPO4710 - Women in Comparative Politics (3)
HBR2200 - Intermediate Modern Israeli Hebrew I (3)
REL3320 - Moses, Jesus and Muhammad (3)
JST3401 - Jewish People in Antiquity (3)
JST3402 - Jewish People in the Common Era (3)
JST3820 - Modern Israeli Culture (3)
PHH3200 - Medieval Philosophy (3)
REL2300 - World Religions (3)

li.Students who are also minoring or comple: Students who are also minoring or completing a certificate in Judaic Studies may not have more than 3 credits that are counted in both programs.
li.At least 15 hours used to satisfy this m: At least 15 hours used to satisfy this minor must be at the upper division level.
li.A grade of \"C\" or above (2.0) is requi: A grade of "C" or above (2.0) is required in each course for the minor.
li.At least 12 hours used in the minor must: At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study: Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.

courseSection0.text:
Other Requirements

Students who are also minoring or completing a certificate in Judaic Studies may not have more than 3 credits that are counted in both programs.
At least 15 hours used to satisfy this minor must be at the upper division level.
A grade of "C" or above (2.0) is required in each course for the minor.
At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship, Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor.
